Get Settings ├─→ Sensitivity slider (0-100) ├─→ Audio source (original/isolated) └─→ Takes detection (enabled/disabled) 3. Filter by Takes └─→ filterSilencesByTakes() - Protect overlapping silences 6. Add Timeline Markers ├─→ clearSpliceMarkers() - Remove old └─→ addTimelineMarkers() - Add new (red/yellow/blue) 7. Show Preview └─→ showCombinedPreview(safe, protected, takes) ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/main.js` (lines 206-325) #### Take-Aware Silence Filtering **Function**: `filterSilencesByTakes(silences, takes)` (lines 334-361) **Logic**: ```javascript silences.forEach(silence => { const overlaps = takes.some(take => { // Overlap exists if: // silence.start < take.end AND silence.end > take.start return silence.start < takeEnd && silence.end > takeStart; }); if (overlaps) { protected_.push(silence); // Yellow marker - don't remove } else { safe.push(silence); // Red marker - can remove } }); ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/main.js` (lines 329-361) #### Timeline Markers API Usage **Function**: `addTimelineMarkers(safeToRemove, protectedSilences, takes)` (lines 377-491) **Key Pattern - Action Wrapping**: ```javascript await project.lockedAccess(async () => { await project.executeTransaction((compoundAction) => { // Create all marker actions for (const silence of safeToRemove) { const startTime = ppro.TickTime.createWithSeconds(silence.start); const durationTime = ppro.TickTime.createWithSeconds(duration); const action = markers.createAddMarkerAction( `SPLICE: Remove (${duration.toFixed(2)}s)`, ppro.Marker.MARKER_TYPE_COMMENT, startTime, durationTime, `Silence to remove: ${formatTime(silence.start)} - ${formatTime(silence.end)}` ); compoundAction.addAction(action); } }, 'SPLICE: Add Timeline Markers'); }); ``` **Marker Color Indices**: - Index 1 (Red): Safe-to-remove silences - Index 4 (Yellow): Protected silences - Index 5 (Blue): Takes (speech segments) **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/main.js` (lines 377-491) #### Read Markers as Silences (User Adjustment) **Function**: `readMarkersAssilences()` (lines 498-543) **Purpose**: Allow users to manually adjust marker positions before applying **Code Pattern**: ```javascript for (const marker of allMarkers) { const name = await marker.getName(); if (name && name.startsWith('SPLICE: Remove')) { const startTickTime = await marker.getStart(); const durationTickTime = await marker.getDuration(); // Use .seconds property directly (no TICKS_PER_SECOND needed) const start = startTickTime.seconds; const duration = durationTickTime.seconds; const end = start + duration; silences.push({ start, end, duration, fromMarker: true }); } } ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/main.js` (lines 498-543) #### Apply Selected Silences **Function**: `applySelectedSilences()` (lines 882-953) **Flow**: ``` User clicks "Apply Selected" ↓ 1. readMarkersAssilences() └─→ Get current marker positions (may have been adjusted) 2. Use marker positions if available, else original detection 3. removeSilencesFromTimeline() [from slice7-apply.js] ├─→ Iterate through tracks ├─→ Find clips that contain silence timings ├─→ Trim or split clips └─→ Return number of clips modified 4. clearSpliceMarkers() 5. showSilenceResults() - Display stats 6. refreshCredits() - Update balance ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/main.js` (lines 882-953) #### Preview Selection Management **Event Delegation Pattern** (lines 683-788): ```javascript // Single listener on parent (previewList) ui.previewList.addEventListener('change', (e) => { if (e.target.classList.contains('preview-item-check')) { const index = parseInt(e.target.dataset.index); if (e.target.checked) { selectedSilenceIndices.add(index); } else { selectedSilenceIndices.delete(index); } updateSelectionCounts(); } }); // Duration filter ui.previewList.addEventListener('click', async (e) => { if (e.target.classList.contains('preview-item-seek')) { const time = parseFloat(e.target.dataset.time); await seekToTime(time); } }); ``` **Selection Functions**: - `selectAllSilences(checked)` - Toggle all - `invertSilenceSelection()` - Invert selection - `selectByDuration(min, max)` - Filter by duration **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/main.js` (lines 683-857) #### Timeline Seeking **Function**: `seekToTime(seconds)` (lines 1240-1269) ```javascript const position = ppro.TickTime.createWithSeconds(seconds); await sequence.setPlayerPosition(position); ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/main.js` (lines 1240-1269) --- ### 4. FILE ACCESS & PERSISTENT TOKENS (v3.5) #### Media Folder Setup **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/settings.js` (lines 218-362) **Flow**: ``` User clicks "Set Media Folder" ↓ 1. uxpFs.getFolder() └─→ Opens native folder picker 2. uxpFs.createPersistentToken(folder) ├─→ Creates persistent access token (no repeat prompts) └─→ Token stored in localStorage 3. Save to settings: ├─→ mediaFolderToken (persistent token string) └─→ mediaFolderPath (for display) 4. On next load: └─→ uxpFs.getEntryForPersistentToken(token) restores access ``` **Code**: ```javascript async function setupMediaFolder() { const folder = await uxpFs.getFolder(); // User selects folder const token = await uxpFs.createPersistentToken(folder); // token is a string that can be stored const folderPath = folder.nativePath || folder.name; saveSettings({ mediaFolderToken: token, mediaFolderPath: folderPath }); mediaFolderEntry = folder; // Cache for fast access return { success: true, path: folderPath }; } async function getMediaFolder() { if (mediaFolderEntry) return mediaFolderEntry; // Return cached const settings = getSettings(); if (settings.mediaFolderToken) { const folder = await uxpFs.getEntryForPersistentToken(settings.mediaFolderToken); mediaFolderEntry = folder; return folder; } return null; } ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/settings.js` (lines 233-305) #### Reading Files from Media Folder **Function**: `readMediaFile(filename)` (lines 342-362) ```javascript async function readMediaFile(filename) { const folder = await getMediaFolder(); if (!folder) return null; const file = await folder.getEntry(filename); const contents = await file.read({ format: uxpFs.formats.binary }); return contents; } ``` --- ### 5. LEGACY vs NEW: XML WORKFLOW vs v3.5 BUILDER #### Legacy: XML Razor Workflow (slice9-razor.js) **Approach**: Export → Modify XML → Import ``` Sequence (Premiere) ↓ 1. Export to FCP XML (manual: File > Export > Final Cut Pro XML) └─→ /tmp/splice_export.xml 2. Backend processes XML: POST /process-xml ├─→ Parse XML structure ├─→ Find clip segments ├─→ Apply razor cuts at silence boundaries └─→ Remove gap clips 3. Import modified XML: └─→ File > Import > select processed XML 4. User sees new sequence ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/slice9-razor.js` (lines 1-261) **Limitations**: - Requires manual export step (File > Export > Final Cut Pro XML) - Cannot directly manipulate Premiere timeline - Creates exported XML file (file system dependency) - User must manually import result **Code Example**: ```javascript // Export (manual - just shows instructions) async function exportSequenceToXML() { const { sequence } = await getActiveSequence(); const sequenceName = await sequence.getName(); // Show modal with instructions // (UXP doesn't have direct XML export API yet) } // Process XML await fetch(`${BACKEND_URL}/process-xml`, { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ xmlPath: '/tmp/splice_export.xml', silences: silences, removeGaps: true }) }); ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/slice9-razor.js` (lines 83-196) #### New: v3.5 Direct DOM Reconstruction (builder.js) **Approach**: Use UXP DOM APIs to build sequence directly ``` Detection Results (silences, takes) ↓ 1. Backend generates cut list: POST /cut-list ├─→ Input: silences[], takes[], duration └─→ Output: JSON with segments {type, sourcePath, inPoint, outPoint} 2. Plugin builds sequence directly: buildSequenceFromCutList(cutList) ├─→ Clone original sequence (preserves settings) ├─→ Get SequenceEditor ├─→ For each segment: │ ├─→ Create TickTime objects (in, out, position) │ ├─→ Create insert action │ ├─→ Set color label action │ └─→ Add to transaction ├─→ Execute all actions atomically └─→ Set in/out points for clipping 3. Result: New "_SPLICE" sequence created instantly ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/builder.js` (lines 1-504) **Advantages**: - Zero manual steps - Atomic execution (all-or-nothing) - Direct DOM manipulation (fast) - No file system dependency - Can batch undo **Code Flow**: ```javascript // 1. Build sequence from cut list async function buildSequenceFromCutList(cutList, options = {}) { const { project, sequence } = await getActiveSequence(); // 1a. Clone sequence (preserves video/audio settings) let newSequence = null; await project.lockedAccess(async () => { await project.executeTransaction((compoundAction) => { const cloneAction = sequence.createCloneAction(); compoundAction.addAction(cloneAction); }, 'SPLICE: Clone Sequence'); }); // 1b. Find cloned sequence and rename const sequences = await project.getSequences(); for (const seq of sequences) { if (seq.name === originalName && seq !== sequence) { newSequence = seq; await project.lockedAccess(async () => { await project.executeTransaction((compoundAction) => { const renameAction = newSequence.createSetNameAction(`${originalName}_SPLICE`); compoundAction.addAction(renameAction); }, 'SPLICE: Rename Cloned Sequence'); }); break; } } // 2. Get sequence editor const editor = await pproBuilder.SequenceEditor.getEditor(newSequence); // 3. Prepare all segment inserts for (const segment of cutList.segments) { const sourceItem = await findProjectItemByPath(project, segment.sourcePath) || await findProjectItemByName(project, segment.sourceName); const inPoint = pproBuilder.TickTime.createWithSeconds(segment.inPoint); const outPoint = pproBuilder.TickTime.createWithSeconds(segment.outPoint); const position = pproBuilder.TickTime.createWithSeconds(currentPositionSeconds); segmentsToInsert.push({ sourceItem, positionTime: position, inPoint, outPoint, colorIndex: getColorForSegmentType(segment.type) }); } // 4. Clear cloned sequence (remove template content) await clearSequence(newSequence); // 5. Execute all inserts atomically await project.lockedAccess(async () => { await project.executeTransaction((compoundAction) => { for (const segData of segmentsToInsert) { // Set color const colorAction = segData.sourceItem.createSetColorLabelAction(segData.colorIndex); compoundAction.addAction(colorAction); // Insert clip const insertAction = editor.createInsertProjectItemAction( segData.sourceItem, segData.positionTime, 0, // video track index 0, // audio track index false // don't limit shift ); compoundAction.addAction(insertAction); } }, 'SPLICE: Build Sequence from Cut List'); }); // 6. Set in/out points for each track item await setTrackItemInOutPoints(newSequence, segmentsToInsert); return { success: true, sequence: newSequence }; } ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/builder.js` (lines 133-295) #### Convenience Wrapper: Build from Detection **Function**: `buildSequenceFromDetection(silences, takes, sourceClip)` (lines 423-480) **Purpose**: Create cut list locally without backend, then build ```javascript async function buildSequenceFromDetection(silences, takes, sourceClip) { const segments = []; // Get source info const sourceName = sourceClip.name; const sourcePath = sourceClip.treePath; const durationObj = await sourceClip.getDuration(); const durationSecs = durationObj.seconds; // Build segments from gaps between silences const sortedSilences = [...silences].sort((a, b) => a.start - b.start); let lastEnd = 0; for (const silence of sortedSilences) { // Add speech segment before silence if (silence.start > lastEnd) { segments.push({ type: 'speech', sourceName, sourcePath, inPoint: lastEnd, outPoint: silence.start }); } lastEnd = silence.end; } // Add final segment after last silence if (lastEnd < durationSecs) { segments.push({ type: 'speech', sourceName, sourcePath, inPoint: lastEnd, outPoint: durationSecs }); } // Build cut list and pass to builder const cutList = { version: '3.5', source: sourceName, segments, metadata: { silencesRemoved: silences.length, takesDetected: takes?.length || 0, generatedAt: new Date().toISOString() } }; return await buildSequenceFromCutList(cutList); } ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/builder.js` (lines 423-480) #### Helper: Color Labels **Enum** (lines 19-45): ```javascript const COLOR_LABELS = { NONE: 0, VIOLET: 1, // Purple IRIS: 2, // Light purple CARIBBEAN: 3, // Teal LAVENDER: 4, // Light lavender CERULEAN: 5, // Light blue FOREST: 6, // Dark green ROSE: 7, // Pink MANGO: 8, // Orange PURPLE: 9, // Dark purple BLUE: 10, // Blue TEAL: 11, // Teal/Cyan MAGENTA: 12, // Magenta TAN: 13, // Tan/Brown GREEN: 14, // Green BROWN: 15, // Dark brown YELLOW: 16 // Yellow }; const SPLICE_COLORS = { SPEECH: COLOR_LABELS.GREEN, // Green for speech SILENCE: COLOR_LABELS.VIOLET, // Purple for silence BEST_TAKE: COLOR_LABELS.CERULEAN // Light blue for best take }; ``` **File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/builder.js` (lines 19-45) --- ### 6. SETTINGS & PERSISTENCE #### Settings Management (settings.js) **Default Settings**: ```javascript const DEFAULT_SETTINGS = { sensitivity: 50, // Slider default (0-100) audioSource: 'original', // 'original' or 'isolated' autoMarkBest: true, // Auto-mark best takes enableTakesDetection: true, // Detect takes by default rememberOptions: false, // Remember expanded state optionsExpanded: false, // Is options panel expanded customerId: null, // Stripe customer ID (Phase 2) mediaFolderToken: null, // Persistent token (v3.5) mediaFolderPath: null // Display path (v3.5) }; compoundAction.addAction(action3); }, 'SPLICE: Label for undo history'); }); ``` **Why**: - `lockedAccess()` prevents other operations during execution - `executeTransaction()` batches actions atomically - All succeed or all fail - Single undo entry in Premiere's history **File**: Multiple - main.js (405-479), builder.js (154-158), etc. #### TickTime Conversion Pattern **Old Way (BROKEN)**: ```javascript const tickTime = silenceStart * TICKS_PER_SECOND; // OK - direct property access (works for these) const itemType = projectItem.type; const itemName = projectItem.name; const treePath = projectItem.treePath; const childCount = projectItem.children.numItems;
